title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 December 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Enygma`> has quit

03:42 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki

12:55 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <D-Spair> has quit  
13:46 <Inge-> has quit  
13:47 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
13:52 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> Enygma`: I don't understand this: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki64M3#HWikiConfiguration  
13:57 <vmassol> it syas:  
13:57 <vmassol> "A new "Configuration > Wiki" section is added in Administration "  
13:58 <vmassol> but there was already a "Wiki" section  
13:58 <vmassol> and from the screenshot it doesn't look like it contains the info from the other ones  
13:58 <vmassol> so we probably have a naming issue  
13:59 <vmassol> actually just checked and the existing one is "Wikis"  
13:59 <vmassol> IMO the names are too close  
14:00 <vmassol> maybe they should be grouped together if the code is in the same module  
14:00 <vmassol> (xwiki-platform-wiki)  
14:00 <Enygma`> not really the same thing  
14:00 <Enygma`> one is the configuration of the current wiki  
14:00 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <vmassol> there are 3 domains  
14:00 <vmassol> descriptor, template and rights  
14:01 <vmassol> spread into 2 sections ATM  
14:01 <vmassol> template and rights have not more in common than the descirptor with the rest  
14:01 <Enygma`> you can`t group them into a single section  
14:01 <vmassol> we could have a Wiki category  
14:01 <vmassol> with 3 sections  
14:02 <Enygma`> probbaly  
14:02 <Enygma`> \*probably  
14:02 <Enygma`> the current section that I`ve added is consistent to what existed in Workspaces and with the notion of Configuring  your wiki  
14:03 <Enygma`> \*current wiki  
14:03 <vmassol> well everything is about configuration  
14:03 <vmassol> so the configruation category has no sense for me  
14:03 <vmassol> :)  
14:03 <vmassol> could be called General instead  
14:03 <Enygma`> might not be a bad idea  
14:04 <Slashman> has quit  
14:04 <vmassol> or could be removed and better categories found to group sections together by domain  
14:04 <vmassol> email has been moved out laready  
14:04 <vmassol> wiki could go in a wiki category  
14:04 <vmassol> now that we have ability to register categories  
14:05 <vmassol> we need to review all the sections in the Applications category anyway  
14:05 <vmassol> like Search and Search Suggest should probably be grouped  
14:05 <Enygma`> of course, all of this is very new and we can`t expect old stuff to use it :)  
14:05 <vmassol> and "Applications" should probably be renamed as "Others" or "Miscellaneous"  
14:06 <Enygma`> yes, was thinking about that  
14:06 <vmassol> Enygma`: it's not hard to refazctor them  
14:06 <Enygma`> since it does not make sense to keep Apps anymore  
14:06 <Enygma`> yep, not hard  
14:07 <vmassol> someone will need to make a proposal at some point :)  
14:07 <vmassol> anyway right now you maybe we can jsut have "Wiki Descriptor" instead of "wiki"?  
14:07 <vmassol> would it make sense?  
14:07 <vmassol> or do you think  
14:08 <vmassol> there's no problem with the "Wikis" existing section  
14:08 <vmassol> ?  
14:08 <vmassol> not sure why that one is plural actually  
14:08 <vmassol> anyway we can tune this later, provided we do it before 6.4 final  
14:08 <vmassol> just food for thoughts I guess  
14:09 <vmassol> (I don't want to hassle you before you leave for holidays ;))  
14:10 <Enygma`> well, as I`ve mentioned, my logic was, in the current context, that it makes sense when you view it as "Configuration > Wiki", like the most basic stuff you have to configure on a wiki  
14:10 <Enygma`> analogy with when you create a new wiki  
14:10 <Enygma`> pretty name, description, owner and such  
14:10 <Enygma`> the exising wikis application was separate and it handled completely different stuff so I did not consider it a problem  
14:11 <Enygma`> but I agree with reviewing and improving the categories/sections for sure  
14:11 <Enygma`> and it would be awesome if, at some point we would have the wiki rights in the proper rights section :)  
14:12 <Enygma`> instead of them being separate as now  
14:12 <Enygma`> but until then, we`ll do with what we have  
14:15 <Enygma`> a jira issue would be useful  
14:16 <Enygma`> ah, one thing about the new additions to ConfigurableClass...  
14:16 <Enygma`> there is no ordering on the sections within a category  
14:17 <Enygma`> so we risk having them under different orders across wikis/installations  
14:17 <Enygma`> just as we have an order hint for categories, I think we should have one for sections too  
14:17 <Enygma`> as an improvement of what we have right now  
14:42 <vmassol> sorry was otp, rading  
14:42 <vmassol> \*reading  
14:43 <vmassol> yes on the order topic there are improvements to make  
14:43 <vmassol> regarding ordering  
14:43 <vmassol> a simple solution would be to order alphabetically the sections with in a category  
14:49 <evalica> has quit

17:33 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:20 <Old\_Xwikier> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <Old\_Xwikier> Starting to look at migrating an older Xwiki 3.5 instance to a newer version.  Should I attempt to upgrade to the latest stable, or upgrade to a 4.x first, 5.x then attempt 6?  
18:23 <cjd> backup the database :)  
18:23 <Old\_Xwikier> Oh for sure :))  
18:23 <cjd> then check the release notes for each major version between the most recent and your version  
18:24 <cjd> then install the most recent version and prepare to do some significant waiting, it does some significant DB migration (check the 4.0 release notes for more information about this)  
18:25 <cjd> start it up, watch the log and have a coffee  
18:25 <Old\_Xwikier> Thanks for the advice!  
18:25 <Old\_Xwikier> I found http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Archives so I'll go over that.  
18:26 <vmassol> the main issue you can have I think is if you had stats enabled and there are some corrupted stats data in your db  
18:26 <vmassol> (corrupted = duplicate entries)  
18:26 <vmassol> anyway you should try it and if you have problems ping us here or on the list  
18:26 <Old\_Xwikier> I also have some custom auth components, and a tempfiles component that I had written for 3.5.. I think some of those used oldcore I suppose that's gone now ? :)  
18:27 <cjd> hrm ReleaseNodes/Archive is not updated  
18:27 <vmassol> still there :)  
18:27 <cjd> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SpaceIndex?space=ReleaseNotes#|t=spaceindex&p=1&l=15&s=doc.date&d=desc  
18:27 <cjd> this has all of them  
18:27 <Old\_Xwikier> :))  
18:27 <vmassol> it \*is¨\* udpated  
18:27 <cjd> you need to read the minor versions but not the point versions, so 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 but not 4.3.1, 4.3.2 etc  
18:27 <vmassol> it's all the archives  
18:27 <vmassol> the recent ones are here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/  
18:27 <cjd> ahh ok  
18:28 <vmassol> now it's time to move some more to archives probably  
18:28 <vmassol> :)  
18:28 <vmassol> moving the 5.x ones now  
18:28 <cjd> would be cool to have a little app to say "I'm upgrading from $X to $Y, give me all of the release notes I need to care about"  
18:28 <Old\_Xwikier> glad I could be of service! :)  
18:28 <vmassol> cjd: hehe  
18:29 <vmassol> I had speced this idea and proposed it already  
18:29 <cjd> ahh  
18:29 <vmassol> I even started working on it at some point  
18:29 <vmassol> but didn't finish  
18:29 <vmassol> I wanted that too  
18:29 <vmassol> my idea was a Release Notes app  
18:30 <vmassol> probably somewhere on the list  
18:30 <vmassol> or in jira  
18:30 <Old\_Xwikier> I had myself signed up for the mailing list, but I think I had to cut it off because of the traffic :)   So I've been out of the loop for a while..  
18:30 <vmassol> users is not high I think  
18:30 <vmassol> devs is...  
18:30 <Old\_Xwikier> It was devs :)  
18:32 <vmassol> you were brave :)  
18:33 <Old\_Xwikier> After a while my brain started to melt and you guys had moved a version or two ahead anyways. heh  
18:33 <vmassol> hope you'll like the changes from 3.5 to 6.4 :)  
18:33 <vmassol> quite a few ;)  
18:33 <vmassol> especially the new skin  
18:34 <vmassol> you'll jump one or 2 skins ;)  
18:34 <Old\_Xwikier> heh, yea I was looking at the current version number and the release notes it looks quite nice!  
18:34 <vmassol> FTR 6.4M2 was just released today and the final 6.4 is planned for mid Jan  
18:35 <Old\_Xwikier> Ok, maybe I'll aim for 6.4..  
18:35 <vmassol> it's the end of the 6.x cycle so 6.4 is a good bet  
18:35 <vmassol> (meaning it's stable)  
18:36 <vmassol> starting beginning of Jan we're going to start work for 7.x  
18:36 <vmassol> starting with 7.0  
18:36 <Old\_Xwikier> Was there work done on the XWikiAuthServiceImpl to make it easier to do external authorization?  I think when I checked last it was quite hard..  
18:36 <vmassol> the extensions have improved a lot too  
18:37 <vmassol> you won't see them in the release notes for XWiki, they each have their own release notes on extensions.xwiki.org  
18:37 <vmassol> hmm  
18:37 <vmassol> I don't think XWikiAuthServiceImpl has changed  
18:37 <vmassol> we do have a lot more authenticators probably  
18:38 <Old\_Xwikier> Or not neccessarily that one, but I think it had some special sauce that wasn't as easily re-implementable for other AbstractXWikiAuthService  
18:40 <Old\_Xwikier> I think I just ended up hacking a sync upon logon to grab current authorizations for my external source and update them in XWiki's native ones  
18:40 <vmassol> you can check https://github.com/orgs/xwiki-contrib/dashboard and search for "authenticator" in the search box  
18:40 <vmassol> there are some and if you can check their source code  
18:40 <vmassol> (in case you need that)  
18:40 <vmassol> our auth expert (thomas) is not connected right now but if you have a question he's your man ;)  
18:40 <Old\_Xwikier> Ok, that's great thanks for letting me pick your brain :)  
18:41 <vmassol> np  
18:41 <vmassol> and send us an email once you've done the uprgade to tell us what you like/don't like!  
18:41 <vmassol> :)  
18:41 <vmassol> we need input for XWiki 7.x  
18:41 <Old\_Xwikier> Thanks, I will!  
18:42 <vmassol> cool  
18:43 <Old\_Xwikier> !jira 1344  
18:44 <vmassol> come on xwiki bot you can't count up to 4! :)  
18:45 <vmassol> maybe you were looking for XWIKI-1344 ?  
18:45 <Old\_Xwikier> heh, ok I found an old issue that I hacked oldcore.. yes it was fixed :)  
18:45 <vmassol> cool :)  
18:46 <Old\_Xwikier> Trying to figure out how much custom stuff I won't need to try and migrate to the new version(s)..  
18:46 <vmassol> yeah...  
18:46 <vmassol> note that we are usually very careful with backward compat  
18:47 <vmassol> so it's likely you won't experience too much problems even though you might be using old and deprecated/legacy apis  
18:47 <vmassol> (we bundle legacy jars by default)  
18:47 <Old\_Xwikier> That's great!   Maybe... humm maybe I'll try and migrate an even older xwiki that isn't used much. It's on version 1.4.9828  
18:48 <vmassol> ohoh that's archeology :)  
18:48 <vmassol> should be fun...  
18:49 <Old\_Xwikier> :)  It's mostly just a base install with some IT stuff/notes..  maybe I'll just copy/paste the contents of the important pages into a new instance if needed.  
18:49 <vmassol> XAR export and XAR reimport  
18:49 <vmassol> (if XAR export existed on 1.4 ;))  
18:50 <vmassol> 1.4 should be about 8 years ago…  
18:51 <Old\_Xwikier> Well it did import: xwiki-enterprise-wiki-1.4.xar Administrator 1.1 20/05/2008  
18:53 <cjd> hm unless there was a major db change between 1.4 and 1.9, it should work to just upgrade afaik  
18:53 <Old\_Xwikier> I was able to just export as XAR.. just in case the old machine it's on dies.  
18:54 <Old\_Xwikier> Gotta head off now..  thanks for the help!  
18:58 <Old\_Xwikier> has quit
